3.9.1.title: Purpose
3.9.1.content:
**Critical Function:**
Pit volume monitoring is the PRIMARY method for detecting kicks:
- Gain = possible influx (kick)
- Loss = possible lost circulation
- Changes require investigation

**All drilling operations require continuous pit monitoring.**

3.9.2.title: Types of Sensors
3.9.2.content:
**Float/Mechanical:**
- Float rises and falls with level
- Simple and reliable
- Can stick or fail

**Ultrasonic:**
- Measures distance to mud surface
- Non-contact
- Can be affected by foam or vapors

**Radar:**
- Similar to ultrasonic
- Less affected by surface conditions
- More expensive

**Pressure:**
- Measures hydrostatic at tank bottom
- Calculates level from pressure
- Affected by mud weight changes

3.9.3.title: System Configuration
3.9.3.content:
**Individual Tank Monitoring:**
- Sensor in each active tank
- Shows level in each pit
- Can identify which pit changing

**Total Volume:**
- Sum of all active pits
- Primary kick detection indicator
- Must account for all pit configurations

**Display:**
- Driller's console (primary)
- Mud logger station
- Remote displays as needed

**Alarms:**
- High gain alarm
- Low level alarm
- Configurable thresholds
- Audio and visual alerts

3.9.4.title: Accuracy and Calibration
3.9.4.content:
**Detection Threshold:**
- System should detect 5-10 bbl change (typical)
- Higher sensitivity for tight margins
- Balance sensitivity vs false alarms

**Calibration:**
- Regular calibration required
- Compare to manual measurements
- Account for mud weight
- Document calibration results

**Factors Affecting Accuracy:**
- Foam on mud surface
- Tank geometry
- Sensor condition
- Mud weight changes
- Active vs inactive pits

3.9.5.title: Monitoring During Operations
3.9.5.content:
**While Drilling:**
- Continuous monitoring
- Note baseline level
- Watch for trends and sudden changes
- Account for mud additions

**While Tripping:**
- Calculate expected fill
- Track actual vs theoretical
- Trip tank provides precision monitoring
- Any shortfall requires investigation

**Connections:**
- Monitor across connections
- Small changes may be normal
- Increasing trend is warning

**Recording:**
- Data logged automatically
- Review trends regularly
- Keep records for analysis

3.9.6.title: Trip Tank
3.9.6.content:
**Purpose:**
Small tank providing precise volume measurement during trips:
- Known volume per increment
- Easy to read small changes
- Dedicated for trip monitoring

**Operation:**
- Fill trip tank before trip
- Route flow from well to trip tank
- Monitor fill as pipe pulled
- Calculate expected vs actual

**Advantages:**
- More precise than pit monitoring
- Clear indication of gains or losses
- Standard practice for trips
